New Records: England's biggest World Cup victory overseas by runs with a 137-run win over Bangladesh
Key Match Events: Reece Topley took four wickets for 49 runs
Reece Topley's new-ball spell of three for 18 in five overs
Mark Wood bowled with an average speed of 92mph
Chris Woakes took the crucial wicket of Litton Das
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh won the toss and chose to field
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed satisfaction with the team's performance and highlighted areas for improvement
Shakib Al Hasan acknowledged the team's poor start and the difficulty of chasing 365 runs
Dawid Malan reflected on his journey and the importance of his performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: Adil Rashid's googly was particularly effective
Mark Wood's pace was consistently above 90mph
